eclasstool.model.chat

Class Chat

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • eclasstool.model.chat.Chat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Chat
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Chat object is derived from the main view of Section 2.7 of the Milestone 4 requirements. The functionality described in that section makes it clear that a Chat is the primary data object of the Chatbox tool.

    The User component of a Chat represents the actual user. The Members component of a Chat is a collection of all users in the classroom. The Chatrooms component of a Chat is a collection of chatrooms available for the user. The CurrentChatroom keeps track of what chatroom the user is on.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getChatrooms

        public java.util.ArrayList<Chatroom> getChatrooms()
        GetChatrooms returns all available chatrooms based on the Member. So, it will use this.user to calculate which chatrooms to show.
        Returns:
        The list of available chatrooms of user.

      • createChatroom

        public void createChatroom()
        CreateChatroom makes a new chatroom and adds it to this.chatrooms. It initially holds zero members besides the user who made it.

      • setChatroom

        public void setChatroom(Chatroom chatroom)
        SetChatroom sets the CurrentChatroom component to the given Chatroom. This will change the main Chat view to the given Chatroom. This method is used to navigate through chatrooms.
        Parameters:
        chatroom - the chatroom to set as currentChatroom

      • setChatroom

        public void setChatroom(int index)
        SetChatroom sets the CurrentChatroom component to the given Chatroom. This will change the main Chat view to the given Chatroom. This method is used to navigate through chatrooms.
        Parameters:
        index - the index to use to get chatroom to set by

      • getChatroom

        public Chatroom getChatroom()
        GetChatroom returns the currentChatroom.
        Returns:
        the current chatroom in chat

      • addUser

        public void addUser(Member member)
        Adds the given member to the current chatroom.
        Parameters:
        member - the member to add to current chatroom

      • getUser

        public Member getUser()
        Gets the user instance interacting with this chat feature.
        Returns:
        the main user

      • leaveChatroom

        public void leaveChatroom()
        LeaveChatroom removes the User from the CurrentChatroom, if the CurrentChatroom is not the main Classroom chatroom.

      • postComment

        public void postComment(java.lang.String message)
        PostComment passes the given message to the CurrentChatroom to update the comments collection. Then it will show the comment on the CurrentChatroom view.
        Parameters:
        message - the string to post onto the current chatroom

      • getQuestion

        public ChatQuestion getQuestion()
        GetQuestion returns the pending question of this user.
        Returns:
        the pending question

      • askQuestion

        public void askQuestion(java.lang.String question)
        AskQuestion prompts the user for a string and passes it to the Roster, which will add the user to the question queue.
        Parameters:
        question - the question to queue onto the roster

      • withdrawQuestion

        public void withdrawQuestion()
        WithdrawQuestion will delete the pending question from the instructor's roster.

      • getPrivilege

        public boolean getPrivilege()
        GetPrivilege returns this user's chat privilege.
        Returns:
        the user's chat privilege

      • setChatPrivilege

        public void setChatPrivilege(boolean value)
        SetChatPrivilege sets the CanChat component to the given value. This controls the user's ability to chat.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to set as the chat privilege

      • changeState

        public void changeState()
        ChangeState notifies its observers of a change in state.
